instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PLT_RST_L: What is PLT_RST_L? This is an abbreviation of “PLT_RESET_L” – when you see “PLT_RST_L", assume the person meant to type PLT_RESET_L.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Post
threads.message: Hello. Got this board here. It's on S0 state, trackpad clicks and CPU gets hot. It pulls 550mA from charger but no post. I tried first disconnecting screen as the internal flex was poked by someone who claimed to have fixed it(?!?!?!). Tried on external display without internal screen connected but no POST. As I was getting VCORE I tried to flash new known working BIOS to it, but still same result. Suspecting maybe bad CPU. Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Post
threads.message:
If the board was already worked in other service, you may waste time now.
There could be broken traces, knocked off components; even intentionally removed.

What is the exact CPU core voltage?
Did you check USB activity too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Post
threads.message: No USB activity. L7210 is 0.972V and L7220 is 0.962V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Post
threads.message:
Then board is stuck, not booting.
CPU core should drop to 0.6V, when board really boots.

<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> comes high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Post
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Post
threads.message:
Is better to return the machine.
It was probably damaged in the other service more than expected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Post
threads.message: Understood. Your wish is an order sir LOL. Will return this crap to the owner. Thanks.
